title: LL discovers a star!
content:
Yes, while looking over Hubble telescope pictures for the NGC, LL herself found a new star in the Orionis nebula.

As such the star will be called LL Orionis Its quite photogenic, [url=http://www.edwinhubble.com/hubble_gallery/bow_shock_around_ll_orionis.htm]here is a nice site about it[/url]

If you don't believe one little forumer can find a star, here is one of the Hubble pictures currently being searched:

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/star001.jpg[/img]

A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: LL discovers a star!
content:
A star called LL.

Well congratulations, but you could at least have called it Keens Orionis.-----------------

title: Re: LL discovers a star!
content:
You're not the only one. But you know that you have the rights to give a star a name if you are the one who discovered it.

Anyway she gives the imperession that she works for NGC?

[quote]Quote:[hr]while looking over Hubble telescope pictures for the NGC,[hr][/quote]-----------------

title: Re: LL discovers a star!
content:
As in:

KR: Hey LL! What're you doing?

LL: Djaser dropped his watch here. I'm looking around this grassy knoll for Djaser so he doesn't have to.


And no, like many astronomy projects, NGC [The 'New' [about 250 years old] General Catalouge is based on amatuers, which discover nearly all the stars and asteroids found each year.]

ANd there is already a star named after [a] not the] Keen, not to mention blaze and mort [Hey, some twit labeled over 2'00 asteroids dull things like 2003167Eureaka!] Search the NGC, its amazing what names are handed out [Xena is taken, so is Sparky]

Also see: [url=http://astronomyonline.org/]astronomyonline.org/[/url]A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: A star!!!
content:
So, how much did you have to pay that old dude who origionally owned that stars naming rights (I'm doing the paper work for the north star right now - It will be the N. Star [Najawa Star [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img] ])

No, really; that's cool!!!

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: A star!!!
content:
The naming of astral bodies must be confirmed by the IAC, any institutes claiming to name an astral body after you for money are frauds. The same star has been 'named' over 50 times so far by people who wanted to remember hurricane Katrina victims. If you hear anything about any institutes like this, report them immediately to the fraud office.A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord
